meanings.definition: A condition characterized by an abnormal increase in the number of red blood cells in the blood.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with polycythaemia after seeing too many red blood cells.
meanings.sent2: Polycythaemia can lead to thick blood, making it harder for the heart to pump.
meanings.sent3: The polycythaemia in his blood made him feel like a superhero with extra power.
meanings.sent4: Her polycythaemia was like having a traffic jam of red blood cells in her veins.
meanings.sent5: The image of polycythaemia flooding his bloodstream was both fascinating and concerning.

meanings.definition: The presence of an abnormally high concentration of hemoglobin in the blood.
meanings.sent1: The test results showed polycythaemia, indicating too much hemoglobin in his blood.
meanings.sent2: Polycythaemia can affect the oxygen-carrying capacity of the blood due to excess hemoglobin.
meanings.sent3: His polycythaemia was so high that he joked about having blood as thick as syrup.
meanings.sent4: The polycythaemia in her blood was like a dense fog of hemoglobin swirling around.
meanings.sent5: The idea of polycythaemia causing an overflow of hemoglobin was vividly illustrated in the lab report.

meanings.definition: A disorder in which there is an excessive production of red blood cells by the bone marrow.
meanings.sent1: The patient's symptoms pointed towards polycythaemia, an overproduction of red blood cells.
meanings.sent2: Polycythaemia can strain the bone marrow, leading to excessive red blood cell production.
meanings.sent3: His polycythaemia was so extreme that he joked about his bone marrow working overtime.
meanings.sent4: The polycythaemia in his body was like a factory producing red blood cells non-stop.
meanings.sent5: The concept of polycythaemia causing a flood of red blood cells was both fascinating and alarming.
